page.title: 16THE MARIE CURIE INSTITUTE
page.content: The building has been a Research Department since 1969. Before that it was a convalescent home attached to Charing Cross Hospital, and was then a home for retired seamen. The building houses 18 scientists and researchers working on various aspects of{cancer research.}The funding for this department is purely voluntary, coming from the{Marie Curie Memorial {Foundation,}which owns 11 homes with a total of 430 beds for cancer patients. The Foundation has its headquarters in Belgrave Square, London. The main objective of the Foundation is to provide in-patient and domicilary skilled nursing care for cancer patients, councelling, advice and immediate welfare needs in kind, and professional and lay education in the field of patient care.
